title: Drawing, "Male Head with Pen: Publ. Ovid. Naso"
description:
In the present head-and-shoulders frontal view, occupying three-quarters of the page top-to-bottom and extending fully side-to-side, a man glances to the left, apparently engaged in thought. The furrowed brow; chin resting on the left hand, which terminates the arm extending from the lower edge of the page; and the pen grasped by that same hand support this interpretation. Publ[ius]/ Ovid[ius]/ Naso, imprinted in capitals above the right shoulder, confirms that the subject is a man of letters, the Roman poet, Ovid.

In the lower right-hand corner is a partial view of the right profile of a man.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Male Head with Pen: Publ. Ovid. Naso".
27.5 x 16.5 cm (10 3/4 x 6 1/2 in.). Gift of Ellen Gustav Jensen. 1956-47-165.
